intro: Holmgrenia hilgardii, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy white or pink flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces a tall, flowering stem that can reach up to two meters in height. It is adapted to arid environments, with deep roots that allow it to survive in dry conditions. Holmgrenia hilgardii is often found in rocky soils and is a symbol of the desert landscape.
